WRITING.TITLE: Why do hackers have to be 'wacky' all of a sudden?
WRITING.TEXT:
So when I first saw trailers and such for Watch Dogs 2 I thought they were trying too hard with characters like Wrench and the way they looked. Surprisingly I really like Wrench but I feel WD2 desire to pander to critics and the GTA audience has ruined its tone. I won't spoil anything but there is a moment in the story where everyone should act serious, which they do for about a minute, then go back to being their normal wise cracking selves.
Also when I run into the FBI headquarters on a mission and kill everyone in sight (you can complete the mission like this) it's pretty jarring with Marcus' happy-go-lucky personality.
I guess I feel 'hackers' don't have to be wacky geeks spouting pop culture references every second. I feel Mr Robot and Watch Dogs 1 do a much better job in telling a serious story around hacking and it's seems to fit what being a hacker is. Constantly breaking the law, destroying people's lives, trying to take down corporations isn't really one big joke where you have to be a 'geek'.

The difference with what we did to the Japanese and Germans is although we put military bases there we didn't dissolve their government institutions like the Nazi's have done to the US that's the difference. We allowed Japan to keep most of its identity intact, we didn't force them to convert to Christianity or control all information they got form the outside world. In Germany we made them turn away from Nazism but they were pretty free after that. Smith is a traitor because he joined up with the SS when their was still an American resistance movement which contain many people from the army. That is the difference here

Okay so the Nazi police generally use the MP5 sub machine gun which was of course made in Germany based on the MP-40 and what came after. But the guy who kills the crown prince uses a Dragunov sniper - which is a Soviet Sniper made in the late 50's/60's in our world.

WRITING.TITLE: 'For them, he must be prepared to give everything... his life...'
WRITING.TEXT: (SPOILERS FOR SEASON 2) So John Smith says this when he is given a eulogy for the family doctor. In the short term he is obviously referring to what he did to protect Thomas. Looking back to the past can we assume family is the only reason he joined the Nazi's? We see Helen is pregnant when the A-bomb drops on D.C. so did he make a choice to join the SS (I think he joined pretty early-1947?) so his family would survive? I think by Queen Victoria's reign was when the limits of a Monarchs power came to be recognised. For example she absolutely loved Disraeli but hated Gladstone who was PM four times during her reign and pretty much did what he wanted in terms of reform without nearly any input from the Queen. She is one of the most loved Monarchs, probably along with Elizabeth I and II, because she oversaw a period where Britain became the most dominant power on the globe. She wasn't merely a figurehead but she was on of the first monarchs to see their old powers really diminish.

The difference with Romans and Nazis is clear. Romans society was established 2,000+ years ago. They killed people who didn't follow their ideology and religions true but they didn't kill for evil. For example their was no explicit racism in the Roman Empire - they had at least one black emperor and many Africans had high positions. Romans conquered and they felt they had to civilise the world but often left minority groups alone if they romanised themselves.
Now the Nazi's come out of a period where we no many of their beliefs were wrong. People knew anti-Semitism, racism and exterminating minority groups was wrong. People knew experimenting on prisoners was wrong. People knew that the Nazi science of having pure blood or perfect biology was bullshit. The Nazi were the very definition of evil - an ideology that was not a product of its time (even though it did need certain conditions to be popular) and you cannot argue its atrocities had a similar counterpart. Communist states came close but Nazi's were a lot worse. To achieve a better mankind why would it be necessary to exterminate or subjugate all who look different ? How does that actually help the advancement of civilisation ? You could still enforce one ideology without it

WRITING.TITLE: (GENERAL SPOILERS) Just watched both season back to back and have never felt so conflicted about TV characters in my life!
WRITING.TEXT:
Wow this show is amazing I have never loved and hated characters at the same. I think Kido and Smith are the best case of this. In the pilot they are just the stereotypical evil villains but by the end of S2 you are actually rooting with them. Both have done horrible things but aren't completely evil men. I was actually coming round to Smith a lot until I found out he was actually in the US army and saw the a-bomb being dropped on DC first hand. How can you then become a Nazi!? I get he had a family but a man like that turning into a fascist!? Maybe his sons death because of the Nazi regime will steer him back towards being a real American?
Kido I actually respect apart from the fact he killed Franks sister and her kids. He is just a product of his empire and will do anything to see its safety. He's not a traitor like Smith. There are other characters I feel this way about aswell: Helen, Ed, Juliana but feel Smith and Kido represent what the show does so well best. What do you guys think?
Btw the way Frank and Sara went out was soo badass!

WRITING.TITLE: Who has been the most oppressed white group in European history?
WRITING.TEXT:
So I am Anglo-Irish and recently been think about Irish history. The Tudor plantations, the brutal invasion by Cromwell, the conquest of William of Orange and the hardship that followed. That got me thinking: who has been the most oppressed white group in Europe? Ireland is one but how do people feel they compare to groups under Ottoman rule in the Balkans? Or in Greece? How about many of the, now, countries that made up Imperial Russia and the USSR? Would love to hear some input on who had it the worst.
(Edit: obviously the Jews have suffered immense hardship in Europe, whether it be in Germany, Poland, Hungary or Spain - but I am focusing on countries)
Just saying it to make it clear I obviously don't remember what it was like to see episode 1 and understand it properly

WRITING.TITLE: Survival is pretty entertaining!
WRITING.TEXT: Definitely one of the better modes had a really fun experience a moment ago. It was all going well-I had stumbled upon a small village with a couple enemies. I took them out, found a rifle and started a fire. Morning came and I set out. It was foggy but I stumbled across a small camp with more enemies. I silently picked them off one by one. As I was scavenging the camp I see one enemy come charging towards me out of nowhere. I pull out my rifle and shoot but miss. From behind him comes a massive bear charging straight towards me! I take some hits but eventually scramble up a tree all hurt but alas the same guy I missed early shot me out the tree and I died after one day! Great experience so far looking forward to trying again!

WRITING.TITLE: What was it like to see the Phantom Menace when it first released in cinemas?
WRITING.TEXT: So I was born in 1995, I apparently did see episode 1 in the cinema but I barely remember it. I don't really remember ever knowing about the Star Wars universe without the prequels. I was rewatching 1 today trying to imagine what it was like (I actually enjoyed myself and the prequels are way better than most action films today) Anyway for Star Wars fans: was it super cool to see the origins of R2-D2 and C3-PO? And to see Yoda and Obi-wan younger and in a different setting? Was it cool to see the emperor as a scheming politician or going back to Tatooine? Or did it all feel like too much fan service? Would really appreciate older SW fans letting me know!

WRITING.TITLE: Downward spiral and how to get back into running
WRITING.TEXT: So this year has been great for me generally in terms of running. 2016 was the first year I ever did any serious running and I clocked 863km (could have been 1000 if I didn't have injuries) this year and started doing distances of 10km. Obviously this should be great news but I got an injury where I'd didn't run all of October. Then I could only manage 7km's. then I got another injury at the start of this month- a pulled hamstring-so I am completely out of action even now. I know I have put on weight in the last month and I'm just generally feeling shit about running. I want to get back to 10km but it's will be a lot of effort-anyone got a story of how they got back into it properly ? Any tips how to do ?

Not the most fascinating in itself or whatever but always a good point to look back at and think 'that's how we ended up here'. The Soviet invasion of Afghanistan just after the Iranian revolution really moved the radical Muslim world into action. The MAK (later would spring into al-Qaeda) set up by Bin Laden funnelled foreign jihadists into the country while the Mujahideen revived weapons and training of the CIA and China.
Fast forward to the mid-90's and the Pakistani backed Taliban won the civil war between the resistance after the soviets were kicked out. The leader of Afghanistan became Mullah Omar who was a friend of Bin Laden. As Al-Qaeda was a floundering organisation he offered them sanctuary in his borders and here is partly where they planned 9/11. After this the war on terror began and Afghan was invaded and occupied. The US then claimed Sadam Hussein had ties to Al-Qaeda (aswell as WMD's) and invaded and occupied them. And here is the context from which ISIS springs out of (a Sunni group who felt oppressed due to the US backing the Shia for govt and armed forces). Again not entirely interesting in itself but I found the overall timeline and knock on affects fascinating.

WRITING.TITLE: How to incorporate Starkiller into Rebels
WRITING.TEXT:
So I was recently playing the Force Unleashed and there is a Starkiller skin done in the style of the Clone Wars animated style and it got me thinking how cool it would be to see him in Rebels. I think they could still make him Darth Vader's secret apprentice and he could hunt down the ghost crew. They could be cool scenes of him killing imperials and Rebels. I think Ezra would be able to connect with him since they are both conflicted Force uses and maybe he would be able to turn him away from Vader since they are a similar age and by the end of it Galen could fly off on his own into the galaxy. Would also be great to see proxy make an appearance ! Does anyone think this could work?
Edit: I don't want him to appear as some crazy powerful dragon ball Z style Force wielded just as a powerful apprentice probably just as good as Ezra

WRITING.TITLE: Super Mario Run is great!
WRITING.TEXT:
So I absolutely hate mobile gaming... like loathe it. I hate the controls and I hate the bullshit micro transactions. I was so happy to buy MARIO and just get a full mobile game that has adapted its control scheme to work brilliantly on a mobile. I am happy to pay for quality and while people complain it's short, it's very replayable-great in short bursts whether it's quickly in bed on waiting for a lecture. The only major downside is that it always has to be online which I would love if they made an offline mode and maybe you would have to sync it up after?
I feel a lot of the complaints come from it not being a full MARIO game but you're only paying 7.99 - for a quality game without bullshit micro transactions-pretty good deal to me!
